title: By the King wee haue by our late proclamation, published for the apprehension of one Anthony Copley, signified what griefe it was vnto vs, that any subiect of this realme,of how meane condition soeuer, should giue us iust cause to put in vse the power of our lawes for any offense against vs in matter of loyaltie.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,
notes: Other title information from first 5 lines of text.
For apprehension of Sir Griffin Markham and others, accused of treason.
"Giuen at our Honour of Hampton-court the sixteenth day of Iuly 1603. in the first yeere of our Reigne of England, France, and Ireland, and of Scotland the sixe and thirtieth."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
